    • Uses of Coordinates in dungeon.maptools

      Methods in dungeon.maptools that return Coordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Coordinates DoorBuilder.findConnectingWall(int[][] map, int roomId)
      Goes through the walls of a room in random order until one that connects the room to a different segment is found.
      Coordinates TestDoorBuilder.findConnectingWall(int[][] map, int roomId) 
      Methods in dungeon.maptools with parameters of type Coordinates 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Crawler.addFirst(Coordinates first)
      Give crawler the starting location as Coordinates.
      boolean DoorBuilder.connectsTwoSegments(int[][] map, Coordinates coords)
      Compares north and south squares and east and west squares, and returns true if both are non-wall and of different segment id.
      boolean TestDoorBuilder.connectsTwoSegments(int[][] map, Coordinates coords) 
      int[][] DoorBuilder.placeDoor(int[][] map, Coordinates coords, int segmentId)
      Places a 'door' (floor) to given coordinates.
      int[][] TestDoorBuilder.placeDoor(int[][] map, Coordinates coords, int segmentId) 
      int[][] MazeBuilder.placeWall(int[][] map, Coordinates direction)
      Checks given direction from current x,y coordinates and if found empty (1), places a wall and adds the coordinates to the list for potential corridor areas.
      int[][] TestMazeBuilder.placeWall(int[][] map, Coordinates direction)
